snippet: More than 30 years after the perils of a nuclear winter were first described by scientists, we still have enough nuclear weapons to alter the climate.
abstract: Op-Ed article by scientists Alan Robock and Owen Brian Toon argues threat of nuclear winter remains despite Cold War's end; asserts even smallest nuclear altercation between any of world's nine nuclear nations could fatally alter climate; calls on Pres Obama to adhere to his pledge to eliminate nuclear weapons by reducing American arsenal from 7,000 to 1,000 weapons before his term ends.

byline.original: By ALAN ROBOCK and OWEN BRIAN TOON

lead_paragraph: More than 30 years after the perils of a nuclear winter were first described by scientists, we still have enough nuclear weapons to alter the climate.

headline.print_headline: Let’s End the Peril of Nuclear Winter
headline.main: Let’s End the Peril of a Nuclear Winter
